newsitem.title: CANADA: National Bank cuts prime to 5.75 pct.
newsitem.headline: National Bank cuts prime to 5.75 pct.

text.p: National Bank of Canada said on Thursday it cut its prime lending rate to 5.75 percent from 6.00 percent, effective Friday.
The move follows a bank rate cut of 25 basis points to 4.25 by the Bank of Canada.
National Bank's prime rate cut matches identical moves by Bank of Montreal, Bank of Nova Scotia, Royal Bank of Canada, Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce and Toronto-Dominion Bank.
Canada's major banks last changed their prime lending rates on August 12, when they lowered them to 6.00 percent from 6.25 percent.
The prime rate is the rate charged by banks on loans to their best customers.
